title: folaranmi72@gmail.com
original_prompt:
Look back in time. Assuming you're a record producer in the 70's. Recall all the songs in different genres, record labels and arrange them in the following categories:
{1970-1980}:
{1981-1990}:
{1991-2000}:
split_prompt:
This is a prompt description:```json
{
    "spliting prompt": {
        "time_period": [
            "1970-1980",
            "1981-1990",
            "1991-2000"
        ],
        "genre": [
            "rock",
            "pop",
            "disco",
            "punk",
            "hip-hop",
            "R&B",
            "country",
            "jazz",
            "reggae"
        ],
        "record_label": [
            "Motown",
            "Atlantic",
            "Columbia",
            "Capitol",
            "RCA",
            "A&M",
            "Epic",
            "Warner Bros.",
            "Island"
        ],
        "action": [
            "recall",
            "arrange",
            "categorize"
        ]
    }
}
```
input1:
{1970-1980}: Rock: "Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin (Atlantic Records), Disco: "Stayin' Alive" by Bee Gees (RSO Records), Punk: "Anarchy in the U.K." by Sex Pistols (Virgin Records)  
{1981-1990}: Pop: "Thriller" by Michael Jackson (Epic Records), Hip Hop: "Rapper's Delight" by The Sugarhill Gang (Sugar Hill Records), New Wave: "Just Can't Get Enough" by Depeche Mode (Mute Records)  
{1991-2000}: Grunge: "Smells Like Teen Spirit" by Nirvana (DGC Records), R&B: "No Scrubs" by TLC (LaFace Records), Alternative Rock: "Creep" by Radiohead (Parlophone)
input2:
{1970-1980}: Soul: "Ain't No Mountain High Enough" by Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell (Tamla Records), Folk: "The Times They Are a-Changin'" by Bob Dylan (Columbia Records), Jazz: "Birdland" by Weather Report (Columbia Records)  
{1981-1990}: Heavy Metal: "Enter Sandman" by Metallica (Elektra Records), Country: "Islands in the Stream" by Kenny Rogers & Dolly Parton (RCA Records), Synthpop: "Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)" by Eurythmics (RCA Records)  
{1991-2000}: Pop Punk: "Basket Case" by Green Day (Reprise Records), Latin: "Macarena" by Los Del Rio (BMG Records), Electronica: "Around the World" by Daft Punk (Virgin Records)
input1_ans:
Sure! Here’s a categorized list of notable songs from different genres and record labels for the specified decades:

**{1970-1980}:**  
- **Rock:** "Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin (Atlantic Records)  
- **Disco:** "Stayin' Alive" by Bee Gees (RSO Records)  
- **Punk:** "Anarchy in the U.K." by Sex Pistols (Virgin Records)  
- **Soul:** "What's Going On" by Marvin Gaye (Tamla Records)  
- **Folk Rock:** "The Boxer" by Simon & Garfunkel (Columbia Records)  
- **Progressive Rock:** "Roundabout" by Yes (Atlantic Records)  

**{1981-1990}:**  
- **Pop:** "Thriller" by Michael Jackson (Epic Records)  
- **Hip Hop:** "Rapper's Delight" by The Sugarhill Gang (Sugar Hill Records)  
- **New Wave:** "Just Can't Get Enough" by Depeche Mode (Mute Records)  
- **Heavy Metal:** "Enter Sandman" by Metallica (Elektra Records)  
- **Synthpop:** "Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)" by Eurythmics (RCA Records)  
- **Alternative Rock:** "Losing My Religion" by R.E.M. (IRS Records)  

**{1991-2000}:**  
- **Grunge:** "Smells Like Teen Spirit" by Nirvana (DGC Records)  
- **R&B:** "No Scrubs" by TLC (LaFace Records)  
- **Alternative Rock:** "Creep" by Radiohead (Parlophone)  
- **Pop:** "...Baby One More Time" by Britney Spears (Jive Records)  
- **Hip Hop:** "California Love" by 2Pac featuring Dr. Dre (Interscope Records)  
- **Britpop:** "Wonderwall" by Oasis (Creation Records)  

This arrangement captures a variety of influential songs across different genres and decades!
